meanings.definition: Past tense of call or name.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she cleped her cat by its new name.
meanings.sent2: He cleped his friend to invite him to the party.
meanings.sent3: The dog cleped itself 'King of the Couch' after stealing the spot from the cat.
meanings.sent4: The old tree was cleped 'The Guardian' by the villagers for its towering presence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher cleped each student's name loudly to take attendance.

meanings.sent1: The ancient city was cleped 'The City of Gold' by travelers.
meanings.sent2: She was cleped 'The Queen of Kindness' by her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was cleped 'The Snack Bandit' by the campers.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak was cleped 'The Roof of the World' by adventurers.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious stranger was cleped 'The Shadow' by the townspeople.
